org.sebastiandine.cardcollectionmanager.ui.tables.card

Class CardContainerTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JTable
            • org.sebastiandine.cardcollectionmanager.ui.tables.card.CardContainerTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.CellEditorListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.event.RowSorterListener, javax.swing.event.TableColumnModelListener, javax.swing.event.TableModelListener, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class CardContainerTable
extends javax.swing.JTable
    This class provides a JTable, which displays all CardBean objects, managed by CardBeanContainer.
    Author:
    Sebastian Dine
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendRowByCardBean(CardBean cardBean)
      This method appends the given CardBean object as a new row to the TableModel of this table.
      void deleteSelectedRow()
      This method deletes the currently selected row and sets the selection to the next row.
      CardBean getSelectedCardBean()
      This method returns the CardBean object corresponding to the selected row within the table.
      void selectRowByCardBean(CardBean cardBean)
      This methods select the row of the table, which represents the given CardBean object.
      void updateSelectedRow()
      This method updates the currently selected row by populating each of its columns again with the data of the corresponding CardBean object.

        public CardContainerTable()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • updateSelectedRow

        public void updateSelectedRow()
        This method updates the currently selected row by populating each of its columns again with the data of the corresponding CardBean object.

      • deleteSelectedRow

        public void deleteSelectedRow()
        This method deletes the currently selected row and sets the selection to the next row.

      • getSelectedCardBean

        public CardBean getSelectedCardBean()
        This method returns the CardBean object corresponding to the selected row within the table.
        Returns:
        Selected CardBean object. CardBean.DUMMY, if there is no entry left in the table.

      • selectRowByCardBean

        public void selectRowByCardBean(CardBean cardBean)
        This methods select the row of the table, which represents the given CardBean object. It uses the attribute CardBean.getId() for checking matching entries.
        Parameters:
        cardBean - CardBean which should be selected in the table.

      • appendRowByCardBean

        public void appendRowByCardBean(CardBean cardBean)
        This method appends the given CardBean object as a new row to the TableModel of this table.
        Parameters:
        cardBean - CardBean object, which should be appended to the table.
